metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2074 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in lib/flow.c in ovs-vswitchd in Open vSwitch 2.2.x and2.3.x before 2.3.3 and 2.4.x before 2.4.1 allows remote attackers toexecute arbitrary code via crafted MPLS packets, as demonstrated by a longstring in an ovs-appctl command.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2074` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openvswitch-common - 2.0.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
openvswitch-controller - 2.0.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
openvswitch-datapath-dkms - 2.0.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
openvswitch-datapath-source - 2.0.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
openvswitch-ipsec - 2.0.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
openvswitch-pki - 2.0.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
openvswitch-switch - 2.0.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
openvswitch-test - 2.0.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
ovsdbmonitor - 2.0.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
python-openvswitch - 2.0.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openvswitch package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.3').
